etymology.description: 高(高) (gāo, "high") + 考(考) (kǎo, "exam") combines to form 高考(高考) (gāokǎo, "national college entrance exam").
etymology.interpretation: 高考(高考) (gāokǎo, "national college entrance exam") is a significant assessment in China that determines university entry for students. 高(高) (gāo, "high") indicates the level or importance of the exam, while 考(考) (kǎo, "exam") explicitly states its nature as a test.

parts.english: exam; test; to verify; to check

examples.chinese: 高考决定命运(高考決定命運)。
examples.english: The national college entrance exam determines one's destiny.

examples.chinese: 学生努力复习(學生努力複習)，希望高考取得好成绩(希望高考取得好成績)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéshēng nǔlì fùxí, xīwàng gāokǎo qǔdé hǎo chéngjì.
examples.english: Students study hard, hoping to achieve good results in the national college entrance exam.
